avdta.vehicle

Class Bus

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.vehicle.Vehicle
      • avdta.vehicle.PersonalVehicle
        • avdta.vehicle.Bus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Vehicle>

    public class Bus
extends PersonalVehicle
    This vehicle travels along a fixed route, updating travel times on relevant BusLinks as it travels.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bus

        public Bus(int id,
           int route_id,
           int dtime,
           Path path,
           java.util.ArrayList<BusLink> transitStops)
        Constructs this Bus with the given parameters. The DriverType is set to DriverType.BUS_AV. The VehicleClass is set to ICV
        Parameters:
        id - the id of this Bus
        route_id - the id of the route this Bus follows
        dtime - the departure time (s)
        path - the path followed by this Bus
        transitStops - the list of stops

      • Bus

        public Bus(int id,
           int route_id,
           int dtime,
           Path path,
           java.util.ArrayList<BusLink> transitStops,
           VehicleClass vehClass,
           DriverType driver)
        Constructs this Bus with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of this Bus
        route_id - the id of the route this Bus follows
        dtime - the departure time (s)
        path - the path followed by this Bus
        transitStops - the list of stops
        vehClass - the VehicleClass used for calculating energy consumption
        driver - the DriverType

        Resets this Bus to restart the simulation.

      • enteredLink

        public void enteredLink(Link l)
        This is called when the vehicle enters a new link. Calls Vehicle.enteredLink(avdta.network.link.Link). Updates stop arrival times if applicable.
        Overrides:
        enteredLink in class Vehicle
        Parameters:
        l - the link entered

      • exited

        public void exited()
        This is called when the vehicle exits the network. Calls Vehicle.exited(). Updates transit stop travel times if necessary.
        Overrides:
        exited in class Vehicle
